definition: In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]
desire/appetite/passion/lust/greed
to capture
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead
warp (the vertical threads in weaving)/vertical/longitudinal/north-south (lines of longitude)/lengthwise/to release/to indulge/even if

sentences.english: He nudged her gently. She nuzzled him back.
sentences.chinese: 他向她温柔地推了推，她用鼻子爱抚他，欲擒故纵。

sentences.english: I'd like to make a meeting with Mr.
sentences.chinese: 你看欲擒故纵我想约见史密斯师长。

sentences.english: I am not playing hard to get.
sentences.chinese: 我不想玩欲擒故纵的游戏。

sentences.english: Releasing in order to catch is one of the general methods in view point of philosophy of environmental technology.
sentences.chinese: 欲擒故纵法是环境工艺哲学意义上的一般方法。

sentences.english: An aloof attitude will do the trick.
sentences.chinese: 玩一把欲擒故纵的把戏吧。

sentences.english: I guess she's trying to play hard-to-get.
sentences.chinese: 我想，她大概想跟我玩“欲擒故纵”的游戏吧。

sentences.english: Some girls like to play hard to get .
sentences.chinese: 有些女孩子喜欢玩欲擒故纵的把戏。

sentences.english: I guess you're trying to play hard-to-get.
sentences.chinese: 大概你想跟我玩“欲擒故纵”的游戏吧。

sentences.english: Do boys like girls who enjoy playing hard-to-get?
sentences.chinese: 男生会喜欢爱玩欲擒故纵游戏的女生吗？

definition: use a long line to catch a big fish (idiom); a long-term plan for major returns
pinyin: fang4 chang2 xian4 diao4 da4 yu2

definition: (coll.) to pester/to harass
lit. seeming neither close nor distant (idiom)/fig. to keep one's distance/(of a relationship) lukewarm/vague
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to adapt to sb's taste/to fit sb's fancy
to spur sb into action by making negative remarks
(coll.) to keep sb in suspense/to tantalize/to keep on tenterhooks
to make a terrible scene (idiom)/to throw a tantrum
pinyin: yi1 ku1 er4 nao4 san1 shang4 diao4

definition: duplicity/hypocrisy (idiom)
to force oneself upon sb (idiom)/to rape
to act stupid/to pretend to be naive
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
lit. please Sir, get into the boiling pot (idiom)/fig. to give sb a taste of his own medicine
